sentences.english: There was a prima facie case that a contempt of court had been committed.
sentences.chinese: 表面上看這是一宗藐視法庭的案件。

sentences.english: The first goal is to show other contempts for the environment.
sentences.chinese: 首要的目標是對環境作進一步的藐視。

sentences.english: He lounged in an left armchair in a stance of deliberconsumed contempt.
sentences.chinese: 他懶洋洋地躺在扶手椅裏，用意擺出一種藐視的架勢。

sentences.english: He refused to obey the court order and was sent to prison for contempt.
sentences.chinese: 他拒絕服從法院命令，因藐視法庭而被收監。

sentences.english: The wise person does not deprecate life nor does he fear the cessation of life.
sentences.chinese: 智者既不會藐視生命，也不會懼怕死亡。

sentences.english: Telling them they are late could be seen as undermining their position over you.
sentences.chinese: 告訴老闆他們遲到了可能被看成你在藐視他們的地位。

sentences.english: He wrote about these things elegantly and passionately.
sentences.chinese: 他非常優雅而有熱情地藐視了這一切。

sentences.english: We threw a look of contempt at him because he told a deliberate lie.
sentences.chinese: 果爲他居心說謊，所以我們對他投以藐視的目光。

sentences.english: Slight, meeting the Gu be cold penitence in the dark night.
sentences.chinese: 藐視它，只會在黑夜裏孤寒後悔。

sentences.english: He was despised and rejected of men, a man of sorrows.
sentences.chinese: 他被藐視，好像被人掩面不看的一樣。

sentences.english: thus they have despised my people, that they should be no more a nation before them.
sentences.chinese: 他們這樣藐視我的百姓，以爲不再成國。

sentences.english: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted;
sentences.chinese: 因爲他沒有藐視憎惡受苦的人。

sentences.english: Your father and I were just discussing his day at work. Why don't you tell our daughter about it, honey?
sentences.chinese: 我真服了你了，在丟了工作的當天還可以這樣藐視我。

sentences.english: Other countries have withdrawn from the IWC and defied the organization outright.
sentences.chinese: 其他國家退出了IWC，完全藐視該組織。

sentences.english: The most flagrant scofflaw of them all is the red-light runner.
sentences.chinese: 最明目張膽的藐視法律行徑要算闖紅燈了。

sentences.english: We are scornful of the forces of convention.
